The Database Administrator 2 provides administration for relational database infrastructure and management systems for all the domains across the organization. The DB2 supports Choice associates who are users of these databases, including end users, software developers, operations staff and technical support staff. Typically, the DBA 2 serves as a lead resource for non-critical database systems and is considered the subject matter expert on one or more database systems. This DBA 2 may work on mission-critical database systems under limited direction of senior staff and/or management.
This role reports into Manager, Database Administration as an Individual Contributor.
What you will do?
Designs, develops, documents and maintains multiple databases.
Provides technical support for the database environment and supports internal teams in the use of databases.
Provides performance tuning.
Under limited direction of senior database administration staff and/or management, plans, designs, installs and configures database systems and software
Develops applications for data migration and maintenance.
Proactively monitors database system operations and activity
Troubleshoots and resolves system performance issues in accordance with established standards and procedures.
Implements of security standards and best practices
Performs back-ups and restores and assists with disaster recovery planning and implementation.
Supports miscellaneous applications with client/server middleware.
Keeps up on industry trends and current technological standards, tools and operational considerations.
Makes suggestions for process, implementation, and performance improvements.
Qualifications needed to be successful in this role:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, from a four-year college or university, or 5 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Relevant industry certification is preferred.
A minimum of 5 years relevant experience in database administration, information systems, or equivalent technical environment. Previous experience supporting highly transactional, mission critical systems is preferred.
Strong knowledge of data structures and database management systems including familiarity with Oracle RAC as well as proficiency with database backup and recovery.
Must be able to rtoubleshoot backup failures.
Strong knowledge of a broad spectrum of infrastructure technologies and secure computing environments: network, hardware and operating systems, servers and storage.
Strong understanding of Service Oriented Architecture and relational application design and development.
Skills, experience and qualiites we look for:
One or more of the following large relational database systems: Informix, Oracle or SQL Server, Aurora, or MySQL.
AWS RDS and AWS EC2
Database monitoring, tuning and optimization tools.
Database reporting, analytic and query tools and interfaces.
Database back-up technologies and tools.
Excellent analytic skills.
Excellent verbal, written and listening communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor.
Proven self-started.
Proficient in the use of MS Office applications, such as Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
Ability to participate in 24x7 on-call rotation and perform after hours support, as needed.
Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment, both independently and collaboratively.
Ability to uphold Choice's Values & Performance Principles of collaboration, performance excellence, sense of urgency, openness to new ideas, inclusion & diversity, integrity, customer focus, and respect.
Must be able to uphold Choice's Values & Performance Principles of accountability, collaboration, performance excellence, sense of urgency, innovation, inclusion & diversity, integrity & trust, customer focus, and respect.

This position pays between $76,949.00 to $102,599.00 and is based on skills, experience and education of the successful candidate.


POSITION CONCEPT:
Designs, implements, and maintains all components of Database Management Systems (DBMSs). Responsible for planning, organizing, coordinating, and monitoring database–related projects and maintenance activities. Develops and implements database strategies that support corporate-wide access to business data.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Perform database-related activities in support of development projects or off-the-shelf software implementations. Identify opportunities to reduce data-redundancy and utilize single sources of data.
Support systems development staff in understanding application data requirements and developing logical database models. Convert logical database designs to physical database models and develops the Data Definition Language (DDL) to create appropriate database objects.
Provide on-call support to troubleshoot database problems on a twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week basis. Participate with other members of the Database Administration (DBA) staff in ensuring primary and secondary/backup support is always available for critical TECO Energy databases.
Perform database monitoring and tuning activities to ensure optimal performance and response time. Provide support to systems development staff (and others performing similar functions outside of IT) in efficient SQL coding techniques for optimum database and application performance.
Maintain knowledge of existing and emerging database technologies and recommend adoption of new technologies where appropriate. Evaluate and recommend database-related products, services, and procedures to enhance productivity and effectiveness. Must maintain sufficient knowledge of TECO Energy business processes and systems.
Review, test, and recommend appropriate revisions to vendor-supplied DDL to ensure database integrity.
Design and implement appropriate database backup and recovery strategies based on requirements provided by systems development personnel and IT Business Partners with oversight from more senior DBA staff. Perform database recovery and restoration as needed.
Participate in data integration tasks for application-specific data access and data warehousing and promote the appropriate use of integration products by systems development staff and Business Partners.
Coordinate and prioritize work assignments based on business and technical requirements; may act as project lead within the Database Administration department.
Provide consulting and support to systems development staff (and others performing similar functions outside of IT) in efficient SQL coding techniques for optimum database and application performance. Considered an expert in Structured Query Language (SQL) for relevant DBMS products.
Participate in projects that ensure the ongoing integrity of all corporate-wide databases and database architecture. Perform upgrades to DBMS and data integration products, including impact analysis, testing, data conversion, and implementation.
Implement and support data integration products for application-specific data access and data warehousing. Provide technical leadership in the appropriate use of integration products by systems development staff and Business Partners.
Enforce database standards and procedures for primary DBMS products in use at TECO Energy. Develop, implement, and maintain database standards and procedures for relevant DBMS products.
Maintain requisite knowledge of all standard operating systems in use at TECO Energy necessary to perform the DBA function.
COMPETENCIES:
Builds Strong Collaborative Relationships
Cultivates Innovation and Embraces Change
Drives Operational Excellence for Customers
Takes Ownership and Acts with Integrity
Thinks Strategically and Exercises Sound Judgment

EDUCATION, LICENSES, AND CERTIFICATIONS:
Degree must be from an institution regionally accredited by the Commissions on Colleges

Required: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or a related discipline is required.
Preferred: Holds an industry-level database administration certification from Microsoft or Oracle

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
A minimum of 8 years of direct work experience in database administration is required.
Other IT experience as a Programmer or Systems Analyst may be considered in lieu of specific DBA experience.
PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Previous experience as a Programmer or Systems Analyst.
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:
Required:
Expert with Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle RDBMS.
Working knowledge of an additional DBMS (Oracle, SQL Server)

HHSC Social Services Applications division is seeking a Senior Logical Database Administrator / Database Developer who has a proven track record in developing and maintaining high-performance enterprise software solutions using Agile methodologies.


HHSC Social Services Applications team is responsible for implementing and managing leading edge applications including Texas Integrated Eligibility Redesign System (TIERS) and the related Eligibility Supporting Technologies portfolio that is used to process applications and to determine eligibility for over 60 types of food, cash assistance, medical, and community care services to Texans in need. We work with cutting edge technologies on many high-impact initiatives that serve various HHSC lines of business. We do this all with an exceptional team of software, database, and dev-ops engineers, working together to make a difference for our customers.


In this position, you will develop, enhance, maintain, and support the databases underlying the TIERS applications portfolio including one or more of TIERS, Task List Manager, Document Center, Enterprise Content Management, Family Violence, and other Social Services application components. You will work closely with the application development teams, our business stakeholders and other partners to enhance the TIERS applications portfolio and to implement new solutions. You will work with a very talented team in building databases and applications using some of the coolest web platform technologies including: Java/J2EE, SOAP/REST web services, Spring, JPA, JQuery, AngularJS, IBM WebSphere, Oracle, and more.


This is an exciting role, demanding a strong background in Oracle database technologies, and is central to ensuring that the TIERS applications portfolio remains available and in service for HHSC Staff and the citizens of the State of Texas. You will work in a fast paced, customer service based environment.


You will be responsible for performing advanced logical database administration / database development, performance monitoring & tuning and providing database related support to the application development teams, testing, and defect repair among other responsibilities. Utilizing Agile development practices, you will participate in backlog grooming & user story development; design, develop, build & test databases; and work together with other teams in support of application enhancements planned to support new program & business requests and to enhance Scalability & Stability of the applications.


In addition, you will provide application & database operations triage support to troubleshoot & resolve functional & performance issues encountered in production, development, and test environments. This responsibility includes both workday and night/weekend on-call support as required to maintain high availability of the applications for various users.



Essential Job Functions:
1. (30%) Own all day-to-day application-specific database design efforts in relation to the assigned applications. Perform and support the design, development, tuning and maintenance of databases including structures, behaviors, performance, security, and recovery. Provide expertise in and participate in the development and implementation of database architectures to meet application performance and security requirements. Serve as a technical resource for difficult questions and problems. Provide technical guidance for database related design, development, integration, conversion and testing work. Educate development teams on database concepts and techniques. Assist with analysis and design of new development, updates, changes, and fixes. Writes and debugs complex stored procedures and triggers.

2. (25%) Implement, administer, manage, and monitor the assigned application databases in production & non-production environments. Monitor database performance. Design and implement performance tuning improvements and advise developers on tuning options. Ensure that data integrity and data security is maintained.

3. (15%) Provide database support (defect repair, maintenance, and production operations support) for web-based Java applications in an SOA platform. Perform analysis, troubleshooting, diagnosis and problem resolution. Analyze software for defects and performance tuning opportunities. Develop and test database code/scripts to resolve defects and improve application reliability and performance.

4. (10%) Configure and monitor alerts. Develop and implement appropriate monitoring tools. Plan for future data needs ensuring that needed capacity is available. Develop policies and procedures to ensure consistent implementation of database and programming best practices. Contribute to improving and creating database application processes and procedures.

5. (10%) Evaluate and recommend database software packages and upgrades. Plan, coordinate and implement database management software installations and upgrades. Assist in the testing of database updates, enhancements and changes to ensure that assigned applications and related systems continue to meet SLA requirements.

6. (10%) Work together with scrum masters/agile coaches, architects, web/java developers, database developers & administrators, system administrators, business analysts, and other team members in performing work tasks. Contribute to teamwork and unit harmony. Attend program design, coding and test walk-through meetings to provide input regarding adherence to technical standards and customer requirements Comply with all Federal, State, and agency laws, rules, policies, and procedures including SOPs that govern HHSC IT. Comply with Department and State guidance on automation system architecture and programming standards. Promote an image of IT excellence and communicate effectively. Perform other duties as assigned.



Knowledge Skills Abilities:
1. Knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of software development and the full software development life cycle (SDLC).

2. Knowledge of industry accepted software engineering practices and life cycle methods.

3. Knowledge of database structures and theories, current database technologies, and data analysis techniques.

4. Knowledge of the principles, practices and techniques of computer programming and systems design. Knowledge of computer operations, systems and procedures.

5. Skill in technical analysis and design, including database design and planning.

6. Ability to work effectively with Oracle 11g /12c, Windows Server, Unix (Solaris) and Linux. Ability to assess future technological needs so that databases can properly evolve.

7. Ability to troubleshoot and affect a solution for complex software and database problems.

8. Expertise in troubleshooting & isolating source of performance issues quickly during slow system response time scenarios. In-depth knowledge of evolutionary & traditional Oracle tuning methodologies, internal views, performance monitoring tools and shell & SQL scripting. Ability to proactively & reactively diagnose and tune performance issues in a multiple application environments. Performing proactive & reactive iterative tuning in databases at various stages of SDLC. Experience managing large Oracle (specifically Oracle versions 11 & 12) databases on Unix in a Production environment

9. Skill communicating with varied levels of staff and end users to develop positive effective working relationships and to establish credibility, trust, and confidence. Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing, to serve as a technical consultant to technical colleagues, to clearly and accurately document relevant issues, and to prepare accurate, concise, reliable reports.

10. Ability to work under pressure and successfully manage multiple overlapping deadlines.

11. Ability to contribute to teamwork and unit harmony. Ability to accept suggestions for improvement and take steps to continuously improve one’s own performance and conduct.

12. Ability to produce reliable, accurate, high-quality results.


Registration or Licensure Requirements:
Oracle Database 11g / 12c Administrator Certified Professional is highly preferred


Initial Selection Criteria:
Required: Graduation from an accredited College or University with a Bachelor's degree. Major in computer science, computer information systems, management information systems, or a related field is highly preferred. Graduation from an accredited high school or GED plus four years of relevant full time, paid work experience may substitute for degree.

Preferred 8 Years: full time logical database administration, or closely related experience in enterprise-class production environment

Preferred 5 Years: Logical Database Administration of Oracle 11 and/or Oracle 12 databases in production environment, including, creating & documenting logical & physical data models, developing stored procedures/scripts/SQL and optimizing/tuning SQL

Preferred 5 Years: Experience supporting application development teams and multiple, simultaneous development cycles

Preferred 4 Years: Experience supporting Oracle 12 in an enterprise-scale production environment

Preferred 4 Years: Experience performing logical database administration in support of Java (J2EE) / WebSphere based enterprise applications

Preferred 4 Years: Database programming and/or script writing experience.

Preferred 2 Years: Experience supporting application databases through an Oracle 12 upgrade

Preferred 2 Years: Experience with RAC, RAT, Big Data, Goldengate, ASM, Dataguard, & RMAN

Knowledge of Agile software development methodologies



Additional Information:
Responsibilities include after-hours support for troubleshooting production issues and/or supporting production deployments.

The Senior Database Administrator is responsible for database administration and tactical day-to-day management activities of production database servers domestically and globally.

Duties, Responsibilities, and Physical and Mental Demands

Participate in strategic database process delivery as needed across the following areas: security, backup and restores, patches, and installs. Create and remove logins; create, monitor, and troubleshoot SQL Agent jobs; create, monitor, and troubleshoot backup and restore jobs; build new installations; decommission existing installations
Provide input around IT database architecture enhancements. Attend project planning meetings; design implementation schemes.
Assist Database Operations Manager to guide business units with regard to project requirements and propose alternative solutions as appropriate leveraging existing systems, processes, and technologies. Meet with development staff as well as business stakeholders to define requirements and create documentation for design and implementation.
Participate in gathering snapshots of existing internal projects and new function product rollouts, ensuring that IT remains on schedule. Attend project meetings; document progress.
Ensure the compliance of projects with technology standards and database strategy, and analyze the impact of each project on existing operational systems. Review requirements and designs per project. Participate in project team meetings.
Interact directly with the Quality Assurance function to define acceptable service delivery metrics and to ensure that these levels are met in the areas of system availability, redundancy, capacity, and application response time. Document baseline performance metrics. Monitor tests for performance deltas. Design and execute remediation steps.
Manage Schema changes in accordance with existing policy to ensure new application functionality is executed without impact to existing application functionality. Participate in weekly deployments; rebuild SQL Server replication as needed across global environment; and work closely with development to remediate issues as needed during deployments.

Education and Experience Qualifications
Minimum:
Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering (or 4 additional years of relevant experience in lieu of degree)
5 years of experience in the IT field with SQL Server 2005, 2008, and 2012

Preferred:
6+ years SQL Server 2008, and 2012

Skills and Competencies

Experience across other major Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) and operating systems a strong plus
Excellent organizational and decision making, problem solving and negotiation skills are essential
Strongly customer focused
Able to prioritize a number of concurrent projects
Solid, proactive communication skills
Able to speak effectively, to listen to others, and to synthesize presentations to the target audience
Sound understanding of Internet technology, e-business tools and architectures, database management, client/server and middleware based architectures
Conceptual understanding of networks, data and audio conferencing
Excellent understanding of Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008, and Windows Server 2012, including clustering with Windows

Job Summary
We are looking for a Lead DBA to join our Engineering Enablement team. Your job will be to build and develop build highly scalable and high availability Oracle environments.

Our Engineering Enablement team within athena is primarily responsible for enhancing and maintaining the core infrastructure (CI/CD pipeline, database, development tools, etc.) upon which that the rest of the R&D organization rely. But enough about us; let’s talk about you.

You have deep expertise in Oracle database operations and administration, and tuning. You have a strong ability to learn quickly and deliver in agile team environment. You can handle emergencies, but have a strong dedication to process automation, standardization, documentation, to minimize the risk of emergency situations.

The Team: Our Engineering Enablement team within athena is primarily responsible for enhancing and maintaining the core infrastructure (CI/CD pipeline, database, development tools, etc.) upon which that the rest of the R&D organization rely.

Responsibilities:
Manage and support 100+ Oracle production databases, as well as standby’s and development copies
Provide response for any database issues, includes rotating 24 x 7 schedule for responding to critical events.
Upgrade system architecture to leverage Oracle technologies such as Golden Gate and RAC
Develop, manage and execute controls in support of athenahealth’s SAS70, Sarbanes Oxley compliance, including disaster recovery tests per our SAS 70 and SOX policies
Implement and support database security regulations, policies, and guidelines. Monitor security bulletins to obtain information of potential threats; install necessary security patches to ensure ongoing database security.
Typical Qualifications

The Database Administrator (DBA) handles multifunctional database projects. The DBA administers development/test databases. The DBA is able to install database management systems (DBMS); related software tools and has a working knowledge of operating systems. The DBA is also able to submit input for modification of procedures and documentation used for problem resolution and day-to-day maintenance.

The Challenge:
Your combination of people skills and technical expertise makes you the team hero, solving one problem after another. What if you could use those skills to improve the technology supporting the Special Communications Missions Solution (SCMS)? We’re looking for a systems administrator on a Windows 2012/2016 platform to help us maintain and support an application hosting Oracle database and form components as well as a web solution.
As a systems administrator on our project, you’ll work with the current administrator to ensure the servers and applications run smoothly and optimally. You’ll learn how to help customers overcome tough challenges through monitoring and performance management. You’ll analyze problem areas and opportunities for improvement in a mission critical network. You’ll be able to combine your technical experience with communication skills as you turn metrics into information and communicate their meaning. This is an opportunity to gain experience in working on DoD government systems. We focus on growing as a team, so we’ll share techniques, work through challenges, and develop new methodologies together. Join our team and solve daily challenges as we improve applications supporting a Navy financial system.
Work as part of a part of a small team supporting a Navy financial system as database and systems administrator. Perform routine performance monitoring and tuning of a Windows 2012/2016 server hosting Oracle database and forms applications. Perform updates to a server for monthly Windows server patches and quarterly Critical Patch Updates (CPU) from Oracle. Immediately support a senior system database administrator (DBA) with maintaining systems and troubleshooting. Apply expertise in maintaining and supporting an application built over Oracle 11g/12c and Java and Oracle's dependency upon it. Perform backups of servers, monitor logs, and perform data imports and exports, when requested. Leverage expertise in working with virtual machines to support the development team.
Empower change with us.
Build Your Career:
When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have the opportunity to connect with other specialists doing similar work across multiple markets. You’ll share successful methodologies and work through challenges as you gain experience and mentoring to develop your career. In addition, you will have access to a wealth of training resources through our Engineering & Science University, an online learning portal where you can access more than 5000 tech courses, certifications and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications? Take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site courses, vendor relationships, and a network of experts who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success.

Experience in continuous integration techniques for SQL

Experience with SAN configuration

INTRODUCTION:
Global Ministries’ vision of abundant health for all focuses on efforts to promote physical, emotional and spiritual well-being through programs in the United States and overseas. Global Health programs focus on assisting economically vulnerable communities to protect children and disadvantaged adults from preventable causes of death and disease. To do this, Global Ministries partners with thousands of communities and health workers through community-based health programs and provides support to more than 300 United Methodist hospitals and clinics. Global Ministries is also the lead agency for the UMC’s Abundant Health Initiative so it strives to prioritize programs that meet the needs of the marginalized.

JOB SUMMARY:
The Global Health Database Administrator will be responsible for the design and integration of a variety of heterogeneous public health information systems and databases necessary for sharing and the dissemination of global health information to stakeholders.

MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES
Formulating validation strategies and methods (i.e., system edits, reports, and audits) to ensure accurate and reliable health data.
Integrating and interpreting data from internal or external sources in order to provide analysis and/or reporting for clinical, financial, and operational processes.
Validating health program results through qualitative and quantitative analyses to confirm findings and provide recommendations based on analytical results to improve programmatic processes or outcomes.

Essential Job Functions
Design, evaluate and improve upon methods used to collect, process, analyze and integrate new and existing global health data sources for the global health unit
Develop queries and reports in GH databases as needed for case-based and/or program -based data for program reporting/communication needs
Utilize statistical programs to manage heath service data from a variety of data sources using relational databases
Develop data subsets as needed and conduct descriptive statistics/analyses for the purposes of improving data quality and usability for Global Health programs
Train Global Health staff and other global health partners on the use of online data submission and review systems
Provide expertise in the application of advanced data visualization methods for the presentation of global health service data
Performs other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION
Bachelor’s Degree or concentration in at least one of the following areas: Public Health, Health Policy, Statistics, Biostatistics, Bioinformatics and Epidemiology. Master’s degree will be an asset.

EXPERIENCE
Three (3) to four (4) years of experience using statistical software programs to perform data queries, management and analyses
Experience with using relational databases
Strong written and oral communication skills, with an emphasis on delivering technical information to a variety of audiences
Knowledge of public health/epidemiologic concepts and familiarity with surveillance data and programs

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS: Please attach your resume.

Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well

Description

MISSION: The Texas Education Agency (TEA) will improve outcomes for all public-school students in the state by providing leadership, guidance, and support to school systems.

POSITION OVERVIEW: Texas Education Agency (TEA) Information Technology resources are essential in supporting school administrators, teachers, and parents across the state of Texas. The Database Administrator performs highly complex database administration work that involves coordinating the planning, development, maintenance, performance tuning, monitoring and administration of integrated database systems; evaluating and reviewing database policies and procedures; and maintaining data integrity and security.

Please note that this role is a term position and is set to end two years from the selected candidate’s start date.

Applicants who are strongly being considered for employment must submit to a national criminal history background check.

Please note that a resume is a required attachment for applying to this position. Incomplete applications will not be considered.

Additionally, please be sure to respond to the short answer prompts found in the supplemental questions. These responses should be added in a separate Word or PDF document in the attachments section of the application.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Oversees, administers and performs the design, development, tuning and maintenance of Oracle and MSSQL databases, including structures, storage, backups, performance, security, and recovery.
Identifies and resolves database issues, perform database migrations, upgrades and data modeling activities.
Provides technical assistance for development of complex SQL, functions, stored procedures and triggers, develops database standards and procedure.
Plans for future data needs ensuring that needed capacity is available, evaluate new features and assist in database strategy and roadmaps.
Provides support for other database systems as needed and perform on-call or scheduled after hours work as required.

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education: Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in computer science, management information systems, or a related discipline.


Experience: At least five (5) years of experience in database administration with a minimum of three (3) years of experience in Oracle database administration with Oracle 12c, and two (2) years of experience in SQL Server.

Substitutions: Each additional year of related experience above the required minimum may substitute for education on a year-for-year basis.

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience with Oracle Exadata, SQL Server 2014 and above, Oracle and MSSQL encryption, container databases, baseline plans and performance tuning.
Experience in Unix shell scripting, Db2 on Linux / UNIX or Sybase database administration.
Demonstrated skill in using Oracle Enterprise Manager and SQL Server SSIS and SSRS.
Experience in Data Modeling and related tool set like ER Studio preferred.
Strong customer service mindset.
Knowledge of database standards, practices and techniques of database design and development, database structures and theories, current database technologies and data modeling principles.
Administration of Oracle and MSSQL database environment including design and maintenance of databases, creating and tuning complex SQL, stored procedures, views, and triggers, monitoring and analyzing database performance.
Experience implementing database security standards, analyzing SQL access plans and indexing, capacity planning and disaster recovery.
Ability to clearly communicate complex concepts, both verbally and in writing, to audiences with a wide range of backgrounds, knowledge and expertise.
Proven track record of managing and coordinating multiple activities in different projects, working with software vendors, outsourced system staff and application developers to provide database support.
Ability to work in a cube environment with potential for significant auditory distractions.
A desire to self-reflect, give/receive feedback and continuously improve.
Ability to engage in a collaborative, results-oriented team environment.

The SQL Database Administrator assists in managing the Microsoft SQL Server 2008-2016 databases. This position is responsible for supporting and maintaining high-availability and high performance environments, as well as implementing and managing the databases in a cost efficient manner. The incumbent should be a self-starter, have excellent communication skills, work seamlessly in a team environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS:

Installs, configures and upgrades SQL Server environments
Establishes sound backup and recovery policies and procedures as needed
Works with IT and business teams to address issues specific to the database/application
Works on performance issues with various business teams
Performs periodic database refreshes
Monitors system performance and evaluate areas to improve efficiency
Specifies proper types of files organization, indexing methods, and security procedures
Performs database change requests, patches, monitoring tools, and resolve exceptions, alerts and issues
Addresses a variety of database issues including integration, maintenance/conversion, capacity planning, and new applications; diagnoses and resolves complex problems in a production environment
Maintains database security
Monitors the performance of the database system and implement required changes to increase performance
Provides trend analysis to support informed decisions regarding resource allocation management; maintains up-to-date documentation of all SQL Server environments.
Maintains availability and integrity of databases through multiple access schemes; facilitate sharing of common data by overseeing proper key and index management and data dictionary maintenance
Maintains replication
Maintains ETL repositories (ODI, SSIS, etc)

Data Mirror) preferred. Experience with ODI or SSIS is required as an Administrator. Replication technology experience preferred. Administration of SSIS, SSRS and SSAS preferred.

The Database Administrator is responsible for designing, implementing, and continually managing SQL Server databases. This position is tasked with configuring, monitoring, and troubleshooting, deploying changes, improving performance and managing security.

Essential Job Duties

1. Creates and maintains integrations with databases for multiple systems such as ERP System, Warehouse Management, and eCommerce sites.
2. Monitors and improves the performance of SQL Server.
3. Troubleshoots, diagnoses, and repairs SQL Databases along with regular maintenance and security management.
4. Maintains database backups and recovery infrastructure including quarterly recovery testing.
5. Executes T-SQL troubleshooting, query optimization, indexing and Enterprise-edition features.
6. Identifies opportunities for continuous improvement.
7. Ensures database integrity, stability, and system availability.
8. Makes requested changes, updates, and modifications to database structure and data.
9. Ensures new and existing processes are properly documented for reference, training, and reporting.

Collaborating - Working cooperatively with others to help a team or work group achieve its goals.
Communication - Conveying information and ideas clearly and concisely to individuals or groups in an engaging manner that help them understand and retain the message; listening actively to others.
Continuous Learning - Actively identifying new areas for learning; regularly creating and taking advantage of learning opportunities; using newly gained knowledge and skill on the job and learning through their application.
Initiating Action - Taking prompt action to accomplish work goals; taking action to achieve results beyond what is required; being proactive.
Work Standards - Setting high standards of performance for self and others; assuming responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks; self-imposing standards of excellence rather than having standards imposed.

Job Introduction
FLEETCOR is currently in need of an EXPERIENCED Oracle Database Administrator to upgrade, secure, monitor and maintain their Oracle database environment. This is an ideal role for an Oracle database administrator who is versed in multiple versions of Oracle RDBMS, on various platforms using different technologies.

The candidate should have proven experience in multi-version upgrade paths, including moving between different OS types/versions, storage formats, and virtualization. In addition, the candidate should be proficient in preparing for and apply database patches in a timely manner.

In this role, the Oracle DBA will work to build, test, document, and deploy quality database solutions that are consistent with project objectives, technology architecture standards and departmental best practices. The Oracle DBA will assist in the design and implementation of new database monitoring strategies, administer enterprise-wide data architecture, implement complex data structures, and provide daily management of all Oracle databases. Candidate should have in depth knowledge of ensuring data integrity, security, retention, and recoverability.

Main Responsibilities

All aspects of database administration including installation, configuration, upgrades, patching, migration, capacity planning, performance tuning, backup and recovery.
Responsible for evaluating patch releases from Oracle and communicating constraints, issues, and timelines for deployment.
Change management including maintenance of multiple development, test, QA, and production environments. Responsible for deploying approved changes to production.
24x7 rotational (approximately 1 week a month) on-call support, including driving Root Cause Analysis (RCA), preventative action follow-through, and participation in weekly operations reviews.
Proactive database monitoring and issue resolution.
Database and PL/SQL optimization including performance tuning, query optimization and supportability.
Actively participate and contribute to projects involving enterprise systems enhancements.
Implementation and ongoing support of high availability architecture (standby logical/physical clustering, RAC, Veritas, hot standby databases, etc.)
Create and maintain appropriate documentation about the database and the data architecture.
Regular proactive capacity planning and tending reviews of all oracle databases. Producing weekly, monthly management reports.
Develop and implement Database security policies and procedures, in line with corporate objectives.

The Ideal Candidate

Must have 7+ years Oracle DBA experience
Must be knowledgeable and experienced on the different versions of Oracle (11g, 12c) on multiple operating systems including AIX, Solaris, and RHEL.
Experienced in database backup techniques using RMAN, snapshots, and exports.
Must have experience with OEM Grid Control, ASM, AMM, and RAC, Unix/Linux Shell Script
Strong skills in PL/SQL, Oracle Tuning and Diagnostics
Experience with Oracle database replication technologies including GoldenGate and Active Data Guard.
Must have experience with Oracle Partitioning
Ability to maintain a positive attitude while working with high demands and short deadlines.
Ability to prioritize heavy workload with minimum supervision.
Highly adaptable with ability to work in a fast paced demanding environment.
Must have excellent communications and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work well with development and infrastructure teams in doing database design, changes and enhancement to new and existing applications.
Support interfaces and back-end integration with applications.
Ability to work on many tasks simultaneously in a high-pressure environment.
Strong organizational and analytical skills.
Understanding of High Availability and Disaster Recovery requirements and solutions.
Experience with virtual environments required

Not Required, but Preferred:
Oracle Certified Professional (OCP) or higher certificates on and 11g.
Oracle Advanced Security, Database Vault
Oracle Advanced Compression
Oracle Lifecycle Management

About The Company
FLEETCOR Technologies (NYSE: FLT) is a leading global provider of commercial payment solutions. The Company helps businesses of all sizes better control, simplify and secure payment of their fuel, toll, lodging and other general payables. With its proprietary payment acceptance networks, FLEETCOR provides affiliated merchants with incremental sales and loyalty. The SQL Server Database Administrator II applies the concepts, terminology, and structure of the current relational database management systems (RDBMS) to assigned work by working on simple to moderately complex projects under the minimal supervision of one or more experienced database administrators. Supports the group by developing and understanding departmental goals. Codes, tests, and implement database structures and database routines using DDL and DML. Performs SQL database administrative functions. Continues to develop skills in database tuning and database set base theory. Assists other group members with RDBMS related problems.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Participates in, implements, and coordinates with others, in maintaining, modifying, and creating database structures.
Develops strategies for data acquisitions, archive recovery, and implementation of SQL databases.
Assists and begins to develop designs for databases.
Assists and begins to develop code testing of code, and implementation of databases.
Monitors SQL databases to assist in optimization of database performance, resource use, and physical implementation.
Monitors and manages SQL database backups and restorations.
Installs, maintains, and upgrades SQL database software as required.
Assists in capacity planning and analysis.
Reviews database changes for system impact.
Administers, maintains, and develops policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of databases.
Provides technical advice to application programmers and business personnel on uses and capabilities of RDBMS.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of basic/intermediate DBMS concepts/vocabulary.
Demonstrates problem solving skills and the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
Meets predetermined deadlines set for assigned tasks.
Receives feedback from DBMS group members indicating the quality of performance and comprehension.
Studies the technical structure and requirements of the DBM system to be supported.
Attends vendor supplied and internal classes, receives instruction form DBMS group members and studies independently.
Demonstrates the ability to utilize training in assigned tasks.
Performs project tasks to ensure that associated deliverables are completed in a timely manner.
Creates documentation in accordance with the tasks performed.
Ensures written communication is accurate, timely and thorough.
Participates in on-call activities.
Adheres to accepted department standards and procedures.
Required Skills:
Strong written and oral communications skills.
Ability to code both DDL and DML.
Some experience with performance tuning and optimization (query optimization, index tuning, caching and buffer tuning).
Strong experience in backup and recovery procedures.
Familiar with the standard concepts, practices and procedures within the database discipline.
Preferred Skills:
Four year college degree and two years’ experience with SQL Server Database Administration OR 3-4 years of quality SQL Server DBA experience.
Experience in OO development, .NET, SOA, C#, VB.NET, XML.
Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.

The role of the Database Administrator is responsible for the planning, implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of critical SQL Server RDBMS systems, to ensure the availability and consistent performance of our corporate applications. The Database Administrator performs the scheduled and repeatable processes such as data backup, archiving and storage, output management, system monitoring, log management, and database restores when necessary. The Database Administrator creates and tracks documentation on database-related procedures, processes and code.
System Administration: Monitors key performance indicators and metric reports which allows insight for the IT organization into our ability to meet customer service level agreements; Determine impact of a new workload on databases; Performs trend analysis on resource utilization; Contribute to the development of standard operational procedures, policies and priorities for the database environment.
Security: Define policies and procedures for corporate data assets; Create policies for data retention on secure data disposal; Perform audit tracking on usage of data and produce reports to validate; Manage authentication and access methods requirements; Manage user-policy usage and requirements (such as a password policy); Creating and managing user accounts and permissions.
Infrastructure Development: Planning and managing the data management infrastructure to meet ever-changing business requirements; Managing strategy for the operations and support of the data management infrastructure; Develop features that meet design specifications; Identify network infrastructure concerns for a distributed computing environment, client/server systems, services based architectures, and any supporting components; Assist in the development of deployment documentation; Developing and documenting the policies and procedures for consistent database infrastructure management, methodologies and standards; Managing data server builds, software installations and testing and deployment of platform hotfixes and service packs.
Database Development: Develop or manage database code features and schemas to meet design specifications; Build/manage schema and features of the desired solution based on specifications and design requirements; Conduct database code reviews during development to share knowledge and experience; Assess the quality of level of the database features at the unit level; Conduct and document results of satisfactory unit-level testing of implemented code; Contribute to, and adhere to database design development standards during solution development; Carry out unit testing as defined in the test plan; Address quality issues identified in the Testing process.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Management Information Systems, Engineering or related field or equivalent experience.
At least two to four years of experience directly as a production Database Administrator.

The Database Administrator (DBA) designs, documents, provides guidance, and supports database infrastructure solutions to fulfill business or technology requirements.
Key Responsibilities
Creates physical data models by gathering requirements and working with application developers, System Analysts and Architects for low complex models with little or no assistance. Converts logical data models into physical data models and generates DDL for implementation.

Participates in recovery/rollback as necessary and participates in tests of back-up procedures to ensure integrity of the back-ups.
Understands and implements replication strategies per strategic solution and database i criticality utilizing tools such as DPROP, Golden Gate, Mirroring, Data Guard, etc.

Overview
The Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for the installation, configuration, upgrade, administration, monitoring, and maintenance of all Oracle and SQL databases within the PHC infrastructure. This also includes the development and design of database strategies, monitoring and improving database performance and capacity, and planning for future expansion. The DBA will also plan, co-ordinate and implement security measures to safeguard the database contents.
Responsibilities

24/7 support of all production database services to ensure the highest standards of availability, resilience, integrity, security and performance required by our business systems. This includes all Oracle and SQL databases.

Installing and upgrading the database server and application tools.

Allocating system storage and planning future storage requirements for the database system.

Creating primary database storage structures (table spaces).

Creating primary objects (tables, views, indexes).

Modifying the database structure, as necessary, from information given by application developers.

Enrolling users and maintaining system security.

Ensuring compliance with database vendor license agreements.

Controlling and monitoring user access to the data in all databases.

Monitoring and optimizing the performance of the database.

Planning for backup and recovery of database information with the IT Operations staff.

Maintaining archived data per state and federal regulations.

Interfacing with database vendors for technical support issues.

Installation of production and test database environments when needed.

Help manage the virtual database environment and assist IT Operations staff in troubleshooting issues.Assist PHC staff with writing ad-hoc queries based on schema knowledge for various reporting requirements, as needed.

Evaluate Oracle/SQL Server features and related products and make business case justifications.

Assist the Data Warehouse team during the design, implementation, and support of the PHC Data Warehouse system.

Perform all patch management and version control across all databases at PHC.

Setup and maintain documentation and standards for all PHC databases.

SECONDARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Must provide and carry a cell phone and be available for consult or assistance when needed 24 hours a day/7 days a week.


Qualifications
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Business related field is required. In-depth knowledge of Oracle 10g/11g, Oracle Enterprise Manager, and MS SQL Server 20xx, with production support experience in a multi-project environment is required. Experience with Unix/Linux in a multi-domain environment including basic command structures and shell scripting is desired. Five (5) years of database administration experience in an Oracle environment and two (2) years of SQL Server administration experience is also required. Experience writing scripts in RMAN for backups, restores, and exporting database schemas is desired. Experience with HP-UX 11.xx OS on an HP9000 hardware platform is desired.

Special Skills, Licenses and Certifications
MCITP Database Administrator certification and/or Oracle Database 11g Administrator Certified Professional (OCP) desired. Experience working with multiple projects/tasks and the ability to prioritize on the fly is desired. Managed care or practice management experience with a health plan is a plus. Valid California driver’s license and proof of current automobile insurance compliant with PHC policy are required to operate a vehicle and travel for company business.

Performance Based Competencies
Ability to quickly acquire in-depth knowledge of AMISYS software and managed care issues. Strong written and oral communication skills with ability to interpret and communicate technical requirements to management, development teams, vendors, and system administrators. Excellent analytical skills to troubleshoot and resolve systems problems.

Work Environment And Physical Demands
More than 80% of work time is spent in front of a computer monitor. May be required to lift, carry, or move equipment of varying size, weighing up to 50 lbs. May be required to bend, stoop, kneel, crawl, or work in other non-standing and non-sitting positions to install cabling, systems hardware and other related equipment.

Promote teamwork and cooperative effort among employees;
Maintain safe practices; and
Abide by the HealthPlan’s policies and procedures, as they may from time to time be updated.

PURPOSE OF ROLE: The primary purpose of this role is to provide consultation and expert technical advice on IT infrastructure planning, and engineering for assigned systems. This includes responsibility for translating business requirements and functional specifications into technical requirements that support integrated and sustainable designs for complex or high impact infrastructure systems.
The Infrastructure Engineer III is also responsible for working with Enterprise Architecture teams to develop the technical direction for the development and modification of infrastructure solutions within various computing environments and for supporting systems integration testing (SIT), component integration testing (CIT), and user acceptance testing (UAT) for large, complex system initiatives.
The DB2 Database Administrator provides insight and recommendations to inform the ongoing strategy for health and care of assigned domain(s) and/or platform(s).

RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENTS
The DB2 Database Administrator will implement and administer databases within a multi-tiered environment.
Monitor and refine processes, procedures, and systems to optimize operational stability and/or integrity and recommends and/or implements improvements.

Ability to write complex shell scripts for operational maintenance and automation.
Monitor/maintain/upgrade DB2 database and assist application team with performance tuning initiatives and builds.
In depth knowledge of HADR backup/restore, cloning.

Ensure business continuity by managing highly available database systems and providing database recovery plans and procedures.
The DBA will play a critical role in design, build, implementation, upgrade and optimization of DB2 databases.
Collaborate with architects and software engineers to ensure functional specifications are converted into flexible, scalable, and maintainable system designs.

Guide and drives physical architecture design for new initiatives by working closely with enterprise solution and infrastructure architects in developing and validating system design prototypes.
Serve as a technical expert for project teams throughout the implementation and maintenance of assigned enterprise infrastructure systems by defining and overseeing the documentation of detailed standards (e.g., guidelines, processes, procedures) for the introduction and maintenance of services.

Provides insight and recommendations to inform the ongoing strategy for health and care of assigned domain(s) and/or platform(s) by identifying and maintaining IT and business-level service attributes for associated technologies.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, CIS, or related field with 8+ years of experience in an IT support environment with technical experience in distributed technologies and systems development.2+ years of Infrastructure engineering experience working across multiple domains, platforms, or specialty areas3+ years of experience in a leadership role with or without direct reports
PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
Master's Degree in Computer Science, CIS, or related field with 4+ years of experience leading technical or project teams with or without direct reports in a large matrixed, retail organization2+ years of experience in an IT role requiring interaction with senior leadership4+ years of experience working in a large matrixed organization, in the Retail industry4+ years of experience working with third party IT vendors and/or systems solution providers4+ years of experience writing technical documentation in an infrastructure development environment

Lowe’s Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving more than 18 million customers a week in the United States, Canada and Mexico. The Database Administrator is responsible for meeting business objectives by planning for and providing reliable, available and secure infrastructure systems. This includes effectively executing processes such as tactical and strategic planning and architecture planning, installation, configuration management, utilization, capacity management, vendor, and customer relationship management and problem resolution.

Essential Job Functions:

Database Implementation and Design - design and implement development and production databases for maximal performance, scalability, flexibility, and reliability. Install and maintain DBMS software including patches, fixes and version upgrades. Work closely with developers to create and maintain schema objects, design and debug triggers, stored procedures and user defined functions.
Performance Monitoring and Tuning -monitor and maintain maximum performance of databases. Identify poorly performing queries and work with development teams to tune accordingly. Monitor database logs for hardware, memory or disk space/ capacity issues and take appropriate action. Implement database parameter and configuration changes for optimal performance with the host operating system. Insure the database environment remains in compliance with our vendor license agreements.
Availability, Backup and Recovery - design and implement processes and procedures to reduce and eliminate database outages and downtime. Implement data backup and recovery procedures to prevent the loss of data from all types of failure. Document, plan and test Disaster Recovery procedures.
User and Data Security - design, implement and maintain database security strategies that provide the appropriate level of security for users and applications.
Responsible for complying with all Company Information Services policies and standards.
Responsible for ensuring appropriate security and privacy measures are implemented on technology solutions to protect Company data from intentional or accidental misuse.
Vendor Management - Works with vendors to resolve problems and escalate resolution within the management chain when necessary. Participates in contract negotiations and reviews and in the Vendor Report Card process. Provides feedback to vendors on desired product direction.
Operational Excellence - Pursues and encourages Operational Excellence in all endeavors, leading and striving on a routine basis through identification and implementation of continuous process improvements.
This position requires extensive or prolonged typing/keyboarding.
This position requires sitting over 66% of the time.
This position requires Visual Acuity at 20 inches (or less) over 66% of the time.

Experience writing SQL and programming
Database and SQL performance tuning
Knowledge of database physical and logical design principals
Able to manage and deploy application database modifications

1-2 years experience with IBM DB2 z/OS, IBM DB2 LUW
1-2 years experience with any of the following operating systems: z/OS, AIX, Linux, Windows
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ability to solve problems.

Company2_Info: Center For Health Information And Analysis
Full_Description:
The mission of the Center for Health Information and Analysis (CHIA) is to enhance the transparency of the Massachusetts health care system and to provide objective, reliable information and meaningful analysis for those seeking to improve health care quality, affordability, access and outcomes. CHIA is the agency of record for Massachusetts health care information and acts as the principal repository for health care data collected by the Commonwealth and is responsible for maintaining such data in a secure payer and provider claims database, known as the Massachusetts All Payer Claims Database (MA APCD). By law enacted in 2012, CHIA was established as an independent agency of the Commonwealth. Prior to the passage of this law, many of the functions and responsibilities of CHIA were performed by the Division of Health Care Finance and Policy.
The Data Operations and Technology team at CHIA is seeking a Database Administrator to help fulfill its mission. S/he will work with a very talented team of IT professional within the Database Administration Unit to support the data collection, analysis and reporting demands of CHIA. We are looking for an enthusiastic individual that is knowledgeable about health care in the Commonwealth, collaborates well with teams, and delivers exceptional results.
This position will remain open until filled with preference going to those who apply within the first 14 days. The full time salary range for this position is $80,000-$95,000 annually.
Under the supervision of the Manager of Database Administration, the Database Administrator will:
 Act as database administrator in SQLServer 2012 & 2016
Act as an administrator and operator using ETL tools, "DataStage and SSIS"
Be responsible for support of CHIA's production Database systems
Be responsible for Development DBA tasks; such as, Data Model Documentation, Source Control DB
 Provide database technical support for Test/Development systems
Ensure the relationship between data is correct and documented
 Assist in the definition of storage requirements
Assist in the documentation and implementation of database back-ups and restorations
Work with application developers to administer SQL stored procedures
 Work with other DBAs in the effort to move Databases and Applications to Microsoft cloud offerings
 Create and Implement DB maintenance jobs using SQL server multi-server administration feature
Qualifications:
A Bachelor's Degree in related areas including Computer Information Science, Engineering or Business is highly desirable, and may substitute for two years of the required experience
Basic knowledge of recognized practices, theories, and methods of system analysis, relational databases and data warehousing
Preferred Qualifications:
Four (4) years of experience as an IT professional (preferably with relational databases)
Experience with Microsoft SQL, Microsoft SSIS, Microsoft Access and Netezza
Experience with ETL tools, and Visio desirable
Knowledge of health care data
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft's cloud offerings.
Total Compensation:
As an employee of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts you are offered a great career opportunity influencing a wide-spectrum of services to the diverse populations we serve - but it's more than a paycheck. The State's total compensation package features an outstanding set of employee benefits which you should consider towards your overall compensation, including:
75% state paid medical insurance premium
Reasonable Dental and Vision Plans

11 paid holidays per year and competitive Sick, Vacation and Personal Time

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Work with a world class team to provide enterprise-wide, Oracle Database Administration support for production systems and provide DBA services to application development teams, including database design, database generation, coding, and database production support. Provide DBA support with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness. Provide accurate and creative solutions to user problems of moderate nature to ensure user productivity.

Provide Development and/or Production support. This includes creating primary database storage structures, designing and creating primary objects, modifying database structure as necessary for enhancements or performance, creating documentation, designing interfaces, database objects, and creating plans. Monitor and optimize performance of the database, plan for backup and recovery of the database, and allocate system storage and plan future storage needs. Create database-related scripts and programs to support development and production environments. Research, evaluate, design, test, recommend, and plan implementation of new or improved RDBMS, ETL and database tools.

Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 5 years of experience supporting relational databases as a DBA, with multiple distributed relational DBSM*s or a depth and focus in Oracle and related tools. Exposure and practice at using the DBMS to optimize performance of large databases for enterprise use is preferred. Experience with an organization with a key 24 X 7 reliance on its database is desirable. BS or equivalent desired.

Granite Background & History
Granite is one of the premier communications services provider to businesses across the United States and Canada. We provide exceptional customized service with an emphasis on reliability and outstanding customer support and our customers include over 85 of the Fortune 100. Granite has over $1.45 billion in revenue with more than 2,100 employees and is headquartered in Quincy, MA just off I-93 and directly next to the North Quincy T Station on the Red Line. Our mission is to be the leading telecommunications company wherever we offer services as well as provide an environment where the value of each individual is recognized and where each person has the opportunity to further their growth and achieve success.
Granite has been recognized by the Boston Business Journal as one of the “Healthiest Companies” in Massachusetts. Our Quincy office has an onsite dining facility and a fully equipped state of the art gym that offers daily Cross Fit, Mixed Martial Arts, and Yoga classes available to employees at zero cost.
Granite’s philanthropy is unparalleled with over $200 million in donations to organizations such as Dana Farber Cancer Institute, The ALS Foundation and the Alzheimer’s Association to name a few.
We have been rated a “Fastest Growing Companies” by Inc. Magazine past ten consecutive years in a row (2007-2016).
If you are a highly motivated individual who wants to grow your career with a fast paced and progressive company, Granite has countless opportunities for you.

The role of the Database Administrator is responsible for the planning, implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of critical SQL Server RDBMS systems, to ensure the availability and consistent performance of our corporate applications. The Database Administrator performs the scheduled and repeatable processes such as data backup, archiving and storage, output management, system monitoring, log management, and database restores when necessary. The Database Administrator creates and tracks documentation on database-related procedures, processes and code.
System Administration: Monitors key performance indicators and metric reports which allows insight for the IT organization into our ability to meet customer service level agreements; Determine impact of a new workload on databases; Performs trend analysis on resource utilization; Contribute to the development of standard operational procedures, policies and priorities for the database environment.
Security: Define policies and procedures for corporate data assets; Create policies for data retention on secure data disposal; Perform audit tracking on usage of data and produce reports to validate; Manage authentication and access methods requirements; Manage user-policy usage and requirements (such as a password policy); Creating and managing user accounts and permissions.
Infrastructure Development: Planning and managing the data management infrastructure to meet ever-changing business requirements; Managing strategy for the operations and support of the data management infrastructure; Develop features that meet design specifications; Identify network infrastructure concerns for a distributed computing environment, client/server systems, services based architectures, and any supporting components; Assist in the development of deployment documentation; Developing and documenting the policies and procedures for consistent database infrastructure management, methodologies and standards; Managing data server builds, software installations and testing and deployment of platform hotfixes and service packs.
Database Development: Develop or manage database code features and schemas to meet design specifications; Build/manage schema and features of the desired solution based on specifications and design requirements; Conduct database code reviews during development to share knowledge and experience; Assess the quality of level of the database features at the unit level; Conduct and document results of satisfactory unit-level testing of implemented code; Contribute to, and adhere to database design development standards during solution development; Carry out unit testing as defined in the test plan; Address quality issues identified in the Testing process.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Management Information Systems, Engineering or related field or equivalent experience.
At least two to four years of experience directly as a production Database Administrator.
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job Description
This is an application Oracle DBA role which requires project and automation background with good communication skills. An understanding of multiple DBMS' is preferred. The DBA Sr Consultant C1 creates database structures for medium to large projects, provides support in the day to day operational management of Database Technologies and aids in software maintenance lifecycle management with little to no assistance. The DBA Sr Consultant analyzes, consults and recommends different options for database performance tuning, database configuration implementation, creates and maintains scripts and test plan execution. Participates in Enterprise incident, change and problem management activities

The Database Administrator (DBA) designs, documents, provides guidance, and supports database infrastructure solutions to fulfill business or technology requirements.
Key Responsibilities
Creates physical data models by gathering requirements and working with application developers, System Analysts and Architects for low complex models with little or no assistance. Converts logical data models into physical data models and generates DDL for implementation.
Provides primary database maintenance and support including creation of DDL, gathering backup and recovery requirements, volumetrics and other requirements for medium complex applications with some guidance from DBA Technical leads.
Analyzes, consults and recommends different options for database performance tuning, database configuration implementation and collaborates with vendors and subject matter experts on complex incidents
Engages and manages incidents by collaborating with application areas, IS partners and vendors by providing detailed documentation on initial failure, restoration activity, and impact analysis.
Identifies bugs and patches related to issues/incidents, works with database vendor support for patch validation. Creates rollout plan for permanent problem resolution.
Proactively identifies underlying problem areas and escalates with appropriate diagnostic details and analysis. Assists in driving root cause analysis on complex incidents. Utilizes Problem Management processes and procedures to document and highlight issues and areas of concern.
Supports proactive definition and installation of alerts and monitors for database performance and availability. Identifies and participates in problem management related to incidents.
Understands, maintains, documents and executes database availability software options based on Solution architecture requirements. With assistance Is able to identify and troubleshoot problems with different availability options
Participates in recovery/rollback as necessary and participates in tests of back-up procedures to ensure integrity of the back-ups.
Understands and implements replication strategies per strategic solution and database i criticality utilizing tools such as DPROP, Golden Gate, Mirroring, Data Guard, etc.
Executes Disaster Recovery tests independently for lower tiered databases and assists for higher tiered databases.
Job Qualifications
This is an application DBA role which requires project and automation background with good communication skills.
An understanding of multiple DBMS' is preferred;
College degree or equivalent work experience;
5+ years in database management, testing, scripting, or configuration
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Overview
The Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for the installation, configuration, upgrade, administration, monitoring, and maintenance of all Oracle and SQL databases within the PHC infrastructure. This also includes the development and design of database strategies, monitoring and improving database performance and capacity, and planning for future expansion. The DBA will also plan, co-ordinate and implement security measures to safeguard the database contents.
Responsibilities

24/7 support of all production database services to ensure the highest standards of availability, resilience, integrity, security and performance required by our business systems. This includes all Oracle and SQL databases.

Installing and upgrading the database server and application tools.

Allocating system storage and planning future storage requirements for the database system.

Creating primary database storage structures (table spaces).

Creating primary objects (tables, views, indexes).

Modifying the database structure, as necessary, from information given by application developers.

Enrolling users and maintaining system security.

Ensuring compliance with database vendor license agreements.

Controlling and monitoring user access to the data in all databases.

Monitoring and optimizing the performance of the database.

Planning for backup and recovery of database information with the IT Operations staff.

Maintaining archived data per state and federal regulations.

Interfacing with database vendors for technical support issues.

Installation of production and test database environments when needed.

Help manage the virtual database environment and assist IT Operations staff in troubleshooting issues.Assist PHC staff with writing ad-hoc queries based on schema knowledge for various reporting requirements, as needed.

Evaluate Oracle/SQL Server features and related products and make business case justifications.

Assist the Data Warehouse team during the design, implementation, and support of the PHC Data Warehouse system.

Perform all patch management and version control across all databases at PHC.

Setup and maintain documentation and standards for all PHC databases.

SECONDARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Must provide and carry a cell phone and be available for consult or assistance when needed 24 hours a day/7 days a week.


Qualifications
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Business related field is required. In-depth knowledge of Oracle 10g/11g, Oracle Enterprise Manager, and MS SQL Server 20xx, with production support experience in a multi-project environment is required. Experience with Unix/Linux in a multi-domain environment including basic command structures and shell scripting is desired. Five (5) years of database administration experience in an Oracle environment and two (2) years of SQL Server administration experience is also required. Experience writing scripts in RMAN for backups, restores, and exporting database schemas is desired. Experience with HP-UX 11.xx OS on an HP9000 hardware platform is desired.

Special Skills, Licenses and Certifications
MCITP Database Administrator certification and/or Oracle Database 11g Administrator Certified Professional (OCP) desired. Experience working with multiple projects/tasks and the ability to prioritize on the fly is desired. Managed care or practice management experience with a health plan is a plus. Valid California driver’s license and proof of current automobile insurance compliant with PHC policy are required to operate a vehicle and travel for company business.

Performance Based Competencies
Ability to quickly acquire in-depth knowledge of AMISYS software and managed care issues. Strong written and oral communication skills with ability to interpret and communicate technical requirements to management, development teams, vendors, and system administrators. Excellent analytical skills to troubleshoot and resolve systems problems.

Work Environment And Physical Demands
More than 80% of work time is spent in front of a computer monitor. May be required to lift, carry, or move equipment of varying size, weighing up to 50 lbs. May be required to bend, stoop, kneel, crawl, or work in other non-standing and non-sitting positions to install cabling, systems hardware and other related equipment.

All HealthPlan employees are expected to:

Provide the highest possible level of service to clients;
Promote teamwork and cooperative effort among employees;
Maintain safe practices; and
Abide by the HealthPlan’s policies and procedures, as they may from time to time be updated.
